meanings.def: to get rid of something you do not want, especially in a place that is not suitable
examples: Too much toxic waste is being dumped at sea.
The dead body was just dumped by the roadside.
Any vessel dumping at sea without a licence will be prosecuted.

meanings.def: to get rid of somebody/something or leave them for somebody else to deal with
examples: He's got no right to keep dumping his problems on me.

meanings.def: to get rid of goods by selling them at a very low price, often in another country
to put something/somebody down in a careless or untidy way
examples: Just dump your stuff over there—we'll sort it out later.
He dumped the boxes down in the kitchen.
They carried him down to the beach and dumped him unceremoniously in the freezing water.

meanings.def: to end a romantic relationship with somebody
examples: Did you hear he's dumped his girlfriend?

meanings.def: to copy information and move it somewhere to store it
to make something the responsibility of another person
examples: They dropped the problem firmly back in my lap.

idioms.def: to make something the responsibility of another person
examples: They dropped the problem firmly back in my lap.

meanings.def: a place where waste or rubbish is taken and left
examples: (British English) a rubbish dump
(North American English) a garbage dump
the municipal dump
a toxic/nuclear waste dump
Radioactive waste has been found at the dump.
They took the mattress to the dump.
a new dump for nuclear waste

meanings.def: a hill that is formed when waste sand from the mining of gold is piled in one place over a period of time

examples: How can you live in this dump?

meanings.def: a temporary store for military supplies
examples: an ammunition dump

meanings.def: an act of copying data stored in a computer; a copy or list of the contents of this data
an act of passing waste matter from the body through the bowels
examples: to have a dump
